name: Project San Francisco
description:
Project San Francisco (PJSF) is a fan-remake of all three original Rush console games made from the ground up with the goal of creating the "Ultimate Version" of Rush.  PJSF is a work-in-progress but already features enhanced visuals and geometry and a fully complete Single-Race mode, as well as an early version of Stunt mode.

PJSF uses source assets provided by the original Rush developers alongside modern high-resolution textures (WIP) and implements modern gameplay and quality of life mechanics while keeping the original spirit of Rush alive! The physics are modern but will be immediately familiar to fans of the N64 titles.

PJSF is a work in progress but already features a number of cars, tracks, cheat codes, and secrets! Future plans are to include all three games' original console and arcade content and game modes while bringing the games into the modern era with online leaderboards and multiplayer.

Please note that the current version of PJSF is a work-in-progress. Many aspects of the game are incomplete and will be improved with future uldates. Currently, the game uses a Debug-style menu as a placeholder while the full game menu is being developed. Please see the included ReadMe file for more information.

All donations received will go towards the future development of Project San Francisco and are not used for profit. San Francisco Rush is owned by Midway/Atari/Warner.
